column4: patch: **** Can't rename file /tmp/poeyGLrd to arch/arm/kernel/process.c : Permission denied
I have no idea whats wrong.
Action: im using sudo.
Action: What do I do then?. I tried chmod 777 on the .tar.gz
for the patch
nothing.
Action: I read that.
what are you trying to change in the kernel?
Disable dynamic ticks and a few other things
yeah you'll need to recompile a kernel for that
is there a simple way to do this for ubuntu..?
I almost never build a kernel anymore, but I find it significantly easier to just grab a vanilla kernel from kernel.org instead of doing it the ubuntu way
The issue is, I'm trying to follow this guide: http://wiki.fragaholics.de/index.php/EN:Linux_Kernel_Optimization
Trism: and this happens to me: patch: **** Can't rename file /tmp/poeyGLrd to arch/arm/kernel/process.c : Permission denied
you're probably building the kernel source in a place you don't have permissions, I usually build it in my home directory
and then copy the kernel bzImage to /boot when I'm ready to use it
Trism: Ah, thank you.
Trism: Didn't realize that..
Trism: Thank you
Trism: I'll try now
no problem, good luck
